etymologies: early 20th century. From crystallo- + -blastic, after German kristalloblastisch

definitions: Of a rock or its texture: consisting of crystals of a number of different mineral species which formed simultaneously from a melt in chemical equilibrium.

notes.text: Such a texture is found in some schists and other recrystallized metamorphic rocks, and contrasts with the textures resulting from the successive crystallization of mineral species such as occurs in igneous rocks.
